result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R. Crawford Jr.

records.addlTxt:
10:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher R. Crawford Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Christopher R. Crawford Jr.  Court states cases and appearances.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim rights in all cases.  Atty Cornia states DE will waive his right to prelims in 22CF175 and 22CF176.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waivers in 22CF175 and 22CF176/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Cornia acknowledges rec. informations in 22CF175 and 22CF176 and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in 22CF175 and 22CF176 and enters NG pleas.  State states the joint recommendations in all cases.  Atty Cornia and DE are in agreement and enters NC pleas to agreed counts.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes fine/costs corrections and makes statement re: the joint recommendations.  Atty Cornia makes statement on behalf of the DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

20CF47
Ct 1:  NC
5 years probation concurrent to any other probation - 3 days credit if revoked
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and follow thru w/any treatment directives
Absolute sobriety at all times
No possession of any alcohol or controlled substances
Not to be in bars/taverns/liquor stores or business whose primary purpose is the sale/distribution of alcohol
Notify agent w/in 24 hours if prescription is received
Random UA's per agent
If a prescription is received it must be maintained in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the prescribing doctor
Domestic violence assessment and follow thru w/any treatment directives
Any other treatment/assessment per agent
Restitution per stip to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

Revoke DL for 28 months
IID effective immediately and for 28 months upon licensure
AODA
DNA sample to be provided
Cash bond to be applied
***Ct 6:  Dismissed

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher R. Crawford Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Christopher R. Crawford Jr.   Global offer provided in older cases, picked up new cases.  DE has cases in Columbia Co. also.  Request another return date.  Court set for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return date on June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:36 PM Defendant Christopher R. Crawford by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Allison A Markoski by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Christopher R. Crawford in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE has not yet applied for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends cash bond at the Court's discrection.  Atty Markoski recommends $250-$500 cash bond.  $1,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with P.K.P.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
